disabled.description: If `true`, the item will be disabled.

autoUpdate.description: If `true`, automatically updates the position of the floating element when necessary.

blockScrollOnMount.description: If `true`, scrolling will be disabled on the `body` when the modal opens.

clearIcon.type: string | number | bigint | boolean | ReactElement<unknown, string | JSXElementConstructor<any>> | Iterable<ReactNode> | ReactPortal | Promise<...>
clearIcon.description: The icon to be used in the clear button.

closeOnBlur.description: If `true`, the popover will close when you blur out it by clicking outside or tabbing out.

closeOnEsc.description: If `true`, the popover will hide on pressing Esc key.

closeOnScroll.description: If `true`, the popover will hide on scroll.

closeOnSelect.description: If `true`, the list element will be closed when value is selected.

defaultOpen.description: If `true`, the element will be initially opened.

defaultValue.description: The initial value of the select.

disabled.description: If `true`, the combobox will be disabled.

elementProps.description: The props for the end element.

elements.description: Object containing the reference and floating elements.

errorBorderColor.description: The border color when the input is invalid.

flip.description: If `true`, the popper will change its placement and flip when it's about to overflow its boundary area.

focusBorderColor.description: The border color when the input is focused.

gutter.description:
The distance or margin between the reference and popper.
It is used internally to create an `offset` modifier.

icon.type: string | number | bigint | boolean | ReactElement<unknown, string | JSXElementConstructor<any>> | Iterable<ReactNode> | ReactPortal | Promise<...>
icon.description: The icon to be used in the select.

invalid.description: If `true`, the field will be invalid.

items.description: If provided, generate options based on items.

matchWidth.description:
If `true`, the popper will match the width of the reference at all times.
It's useful for `autocomplete`, `date-picker` and `select` patterns.

middleware.type: (false | { name: string; options?: any; fn: (state: { x: number; y: number; placement: Placement; platform: Platform; strategy: Strategy; initialPlacement: Placement; middlewareData: MiddlewareData; rects: ElementRects; elements: Elements; }) => Promisable<...>; } | null | undefined)[]
middleware.description:
Array of middleware objects to modify the positioning or provide data for
rendering.

multiple.description: If `true`, the select will be multiple.

offset.description: The main and cross-axis offset to displace popper element from its reference element.

onChange.description: The callback invoked when value state changes.

onClose.description: Callback invoked to close the element.

onOpen.description: Callback invoked to open the element.

open.description: If `true`, the element will be opened.

openOnClick.description: If `true`, the combobox will be opened when click on the field.

placement.description: The placement of the popper relative to its reference.

preventOverflow.description: If `true`, will prevent the popper from being cut off and ensure it's visible within the boundary area.

readOnly.description: If `true`, the combobox will be readonly.

render.description: The function to render the selected items.

required.description: If `true`, the field will be required.

separator.description: The visual separator between each value.

strategy.description: The CSS positioning strategy to use.

whileElementsMounted.type:
(
  reference: HTMLButtonElement,
  floating: HTMLElement,
  update: () => void,
) => () => void
whileElementsMounted.description:
A callback invoked when both the reference and floating elements are
mounted, and cleaned up when either is unmounted. This is useful for
setting up event listeners (e.g. pass `autoUpdate`).
